inference:
Since the area of the equilateral triangle is \(A=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}s^2\), and the area of each shaded region is \(A_s=\frac{1}{4}s^2\), the probability that the tip of the spinner will land in a shaded area is $$P=\frac{A_s}{A}=\frac{1}{4}/\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}$$
$$Final Answer: \boxed{\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}}. I hope it is correct.$$
ground_truth: There are six sections in which the spinner can come to rest, and it is equally likely that it will come to rest in each of the sections. Thus, the probability that it will come to rest in one of the two shaded regions is $\frac{2}{6} = \boxed{\frac{1}{3}}$.
